title: Bug 12906 - Unable to open a file in a different editor when it is already opened in one editor
description: When attempting to open a file in a different editor while it is already opened in one editor, the expected behavior is to display a warning message indicating that there may be unsaved changes and asking if the user wants to proceed. However, currently, no warning message is displayed.
OB:
1. Close all open files.
2. Go to the Java Perspective.
3. Double-click on a Java file to open it in the workbench.
4. Right-click on the same Java file.
5. Select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
6. Observe that nothing happens.

The workbench should display a warning message indicating that there may be unsaved changes and asking if the user wants to proceed.

We believe it is a safety feature implemented in WSAD to prevent external editing while a file is already opened in WSAD.
EB: However, when attempting to open a file in a different editor while it is already opened in one editor, a warning message should be displayed indicating that there may be unsaved changes and asking if the user wants to proceed.
SR:
1. Close all open files.
2. Go to the Java Perspective.
3. Double-click on a Java file to open it in the workbench.
4. Right-click on the same Java file.
5. Select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
6. Verify that a warning message is displayed indicating that there may be unsaved changes and asking if the user wants to proceed.
